name: Coral Sea Resort

reviews.text: We went to the Whitsundays as part of our honeymoon around Australia and wanted to stay near the gateway to the Whitsundays. I would not call the hotel luxurious but was definately very comfortable. We got a suite which was very big with our own jacuzzi on the balcony overlooking the sea! The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely friendly. The best part of the hotel was the great pool. It was a good size and plently of sun loungers for everyone. The hotel managed to book a number of day activities for us, which was very handy.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the area.

reviews.text: We only had lunch in the hotel but the food was still very good. If I was to go back to Airlie Beach would definately stay there. Howerver, Airlie beach is real backpackers paradise!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Perfect location

reviews.text: Our stay at the Coral Sea was sadly only for 3 nights, thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the rooms are very clean and bright, ours had a balcony but the rest of my family didn't which they were quite disappointed about, so make sure when you book. The rooms with sea view are quite alot more expensive, but the view looks fantastic. Pool is fab and is heated, the sun loungers around the pool area have palm trees and the beautiful view of the sea. Didn't try any of the restaurants, so can't comment on that.
reviews.title: A Restful and Restorative Stay

reviews.text: The resort shop arranged some lovely tours for us - Whitsunday Islands and Whitehaven beach were out of this world! and barrier reef tour where we actualy participated in the scuba diving for learners and the snorkelling a fantastic experience and day out with great food too.
reviews.title: Good Location, Noisy Hotel
Great Location ! I will come back......
reviews.text: There is also a lovely man made lagoon about 5 miniutes walk from resort, this is really nice especially for little ones and there's lots of places to eat and drink in the town if you're interested, but there are alot of quite rowdy youngsters.

We really enjoyed our stay in this place. The Coral Sea Resort is located in possibly the best location in Airlie, being close to the town centre, but getting all the best views from it's location on a small penninsula.
reviews.title: Cracking location and great accomodation in Airlie

likes.disliked: — The views from over the pool / sea are probably the best, but the higher the floor the better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 'bayview' room on the top floor, with offered good views of one corner of the bay (although our view was slightly obscured by another block, I suspect this is one of those hotels where your quality of view depends on which room you end up being allocated, or how much you've paid for your room).
reviews.title: a beautiful location

likes.disliked: — a distance from shute harbour to catch the ferries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is a great place to hang out, it has a nice restaruant/bar area, and some excellent views over the bay.
reviews.title: WOW - What a fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, clean, and modern. We loved the open plan bathroom (you can give youself more privacy by moving a partial wooden partition across), and the room also offers broadband for a fee. The aircon is a modern unit, quieter than most.
reviews.title: wedding day disaster

reviews.text: The place is an enjoyable 5 min walk along the coast to the main part of town where all the bars etc, parking is free.
reviews.title: Fabulous

description: Positioned on the absolute ocean front and just a short stroll via seaside boardwalk to the enchanting Airlie Beach resort village; with its relaxed atmosphere and collection of eclectic shops and cafes; lies the Coral Sea Resort. A stroll in the opposite direction crossing a separate boardwalk with the sea below is Abel Point Marina, your direct access to the Whitsunday Islands and the Great Barrier Reef.
